data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: Core Kyoto
data.episodeTitle: The Tale of Genji: Elegance That Transcends the Ages
data.description: This 11th-century novel is set in the imperial court. As a work of literature and paintings, it captured people's hearts, profoundly influencing the culture of the ancient capital for a millennium.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Core Kyoto_The Tale of Genji: Elegance That Transcends the Ages;w01,001;2029-211-2025;2025-10-31T00:30:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;Core Kyoto_The Tale of Genji: Elegance That Transcends the Ages;en,001;2029-211-2025;2025-10-31T00:30:00+09:00

data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: Outside in Lost in Academia
data.episodeTitle: In Deep with Snack Bars
data.description: Japan's snack bars are a unique form of nightlife. Harvard-trained anthropologist Maura McGrath's research reveals a fascinating look into this world. What secrets do they hold?
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Outside in Lost in Academia_In Deep with Snack Bars;w01,001;4047-002-2025;2025-10-31T01:30:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;Outside in Lost in Academia_In Deep with Snack Bars;en,001;4047-002-2025;2025-10-31T01:30:00+09:00

data.title: NHK NEWSLINE
data.description: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

data.title: The Musical Diplomat: Playing a Bridge for Two Countries
data.description: Renowned pianist Lee Kyung-mi uses her talent to foster better ties between Japan and South Korea.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;The Musical Diplomat: Playing a Bridge for Two Countries_;w01,001;3025-252-2025;2025-10-31T02:30:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;The Musical Diplomat: Playing a Bridge for Two Countries_;en,001;3025-252-2025;2025-10-31T02:30:00+09:00

data.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
data.description: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

data.title: Direct Talk
data.episodeTitle: The Beauty and Art of Watchmaking
data.description: Makihara Daizoh is drawing attention from around the world for crafting timepieces that embody a Japanese aesthetic. He talks about the appeal of analog watchmaking in the digital age.

data.title: DOSUKOI Sumo Salon
data.episodeTitle: Uwate Dashinage: Pulling Overarm Throw
data.description: This technique has been used in clutch moments in some historic bouts. We learn how it's different from the overarm throw and hear secrets of how it's done from the masters!

data.title: RAMEN JAPAN
data.episodeTitle: TONKOTSU RAMEN: FUKUOKA Part 2
data.description: A fantastic tale of love for local flavor, set in Kurume, the birthplace of tonkotsu ramen.

data.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
data.episodeTitle: The Great Wave off Kanagawa by Katsushika Hokusai
data.description: Discover story behind the "36 Views of Mt. Fuji" woodprint series; "The Great Wave off Kanagawa" by Hokusai. It is not just a huge wave and Mt. Fuji, the boat caught in the wave have a reason.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE_The Great Wave off Kanagawa by Katsushika Hokusai;w01,001;6030-001-2025;2025-10-31T03:55:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE_The Great Wave off Kanagawa by Katsushika Hokusai;en,001;6030-001-2025;2025-10-31T03:55:00+09:00

data.title: Hometown Stories
data.episodeTitle: Playing Ping Pong with Parkinson's
data.description: Koyama Rie was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease several years ago. An avid table-tennis player, she now teaches the sport to fellow Parkinson's patients to improve their health and their outlook.

data.title: Satoyama Kitchen Diary
data.episodeTitle: Field Work Fueled by Leaf-wrapped Sushi
data.description: Hi, it's me, Tama! When I saw a rainbow this morning, I got the feeling there'd be something yummy for me today, and I was right! Grandma Nobuko and Grandpa Makoto are making leaf- wrapped sushi. I can't wait!
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Satoyama Kitchen Diary_Field Work Fueled by Leaf-wrapped Sushi;w01,001;6051-004-2025;2025-10-31T04:27:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;Satoyama Kitchen Diary_Field Work Fueled by Leaf-wrapped Sushi;en,001;6051-004-2025;2025-10-31T04:27:00+09:00

data.title: Japanology Plus
data.episodeTitle: Japanophiles: Stephanie Crohin
data.description:
*First broadcast on September 26, 2024.
French journalist and "sento ambassador" Stephanie Crohin promotes sento, or public bathhouses, on social media. She tells Peter Barakan about her love for the heartwarming world of public baths.

data.title: Asia Insight
data.episodeTitle: The Hui: Muslim Merchants Thriving in China
data.description: In Yiwu, China, the Muslim Hui people expand trade with Arab countries using their Arabic language skills. They are becoming an essential presence as China shifts away from US trade and diversifies.

data.title: Japan in Focus
data.episodeTitle: Ama Divers Restoring the Earthquake-Hit Seabed
data.description: In 2024, natural disasters devastated the fishing grounds of the ama (free divers) in Wajima, Noto. We follow their efforts to survey the seabed and revive their tradition.

data.title: Seasoning the Seasons
data.episodeTitle: Faith in Tenjin - Prayers from across Japan
data.description: A group of well-loved shrines, with branches all across Japan, are affectionately known by the nickname of Tenjin-sama. These shrines are dedicated to the remarkable ninth century politician and scholar Sugawara Michizane, who was posthumously deified under the name of Tenjin. We visit a number of these shrines where Tenjin is venerated and loved as a symbol of learning.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;Seasoning the Seasons_Faith in Tenjin - Prayers from across Japan;w01,001;2024-158-2025;2025-10-31T13:30:00+09:00

data.title: Document 72 Hours
data.episodeTitle: Lion Statue Donations at Shinjuku Station
data.description: A roaring golden lion statue outside Shinjuku Station is a donation box for disaster relief and youth support. Many walk past while others offer small kindnesses. Who donates over 72 hours, and why?

data.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
data.description: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

data.title: Direct Talk
data.episodeTitle: New Life for the Samurai Genre
data.description: Yasuda Junichi directed "A Samurai in Time," a playful film made on a shoestring budget that became a word-of-mouth hit. Yasuda, who is also a rice farmer, gives us the behind-the-scenes story.

data.title: IMPACTS: Climates Change the World
data.episodeTitle: Protecting Rock Ptarmigan From Global Warming
data.description: Global warming is impacting ecosystems and bird habitats in the world's mountainous regions. In the Japanese Alps, various efforts are underway to protect the endangered Japanese rock ptarmigan.
data.analyticsSimul: [nhkworld]simul;IMPACTS: Climates Change the World_Protecting Rock Ptarmigan From Global Warming;w01,001;6128-004-2025;2025-10-31T20:43:00+09:00
data.analyticsVod: [nhkworld]vod;IMPACTS: Climates Change the World_Protecting Rock Ptarmigan From Global Warming;en,001;6128-004-2025;2025-10-31T20:43:00+09:00

data.title: Chatroom Japan
data.episodeTitle: The Local "Sento" - More Than a Bath
data.description: Have you ever been to a sento? Christian Dimmer, a German urbanist living in Japan, focuses on the community-building potential of Japan's public bathhouses. It is common these days in our society to live alone or in single-family units. He hopes that people can rediscover the value of the community communication nourished by public bathhouses.

data.title: Design  Stories
data.episodeTitle: Line Designs
data.description: Today's theme: Line Designs. These are evolving in many fields across Japan, from the traditional art of calligraphy to furniture, and architecture. Explore a truly diverse world of line designs.
